channel.title: Port forwrding and path files help on my first server
channel.description:
Background~ Im using pk planets sorce for a 317 or which ever one it may be, i cant seem to wright the path and class path files, im following the "how to make a server" tut from the index.
Whats not working~ under Environmental variables, there was no CLASSPATH, file so i created one and under the value i copy and pasted what the classpath file is spouse to say, and the path file i deleted what it said and replaced it with what the PATH file was spouse to say, when i did ipconfig on CMD, i got a messege that it wasnt recagnized as a intarnal or external command, and i play another server and i thought id take a break and tryed to run it and it dint work eather, i serched env. varab. on wikipidea and copy and pasted what the path file was spouse to say, after i fixed the path files and deleted the classpath file i rebooted my computer and the client was working again.
What i need~ ~Write the PATH & CLASSPATH files ~Portforward, i have a linkins wireless router so its a lot diffrent [looks a lot diffrent] than the tut so i dont know how to forward it correctlly ~No-ip, how to i connect it with my server, i made a host thing for it ~Getting it online [as in i cant log on and i want to launch ut] ~Also i want to know how to add new items from making the codes and making it from scratch like for a new cape, will you use a normal cape and just use it with paint to fix it up?
email singhssa96@yahoo.com same for msn

item.title: Port forwrding and path files help on my first server
item.dc:creator: @sone14 sone14
item.description:
@sone14 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:352554”]To find the Ip using Command Prompt.

Start > Run > “CMD”
“cd C:\WINDOWS\system32”
“ipconfig”

Do not use the quotations while typing in Command Prompt.

For the No-IP issue, you just make a host.
Other users will connect via the host, while you connect with localhost.

Getting it online:
Make sure the server is running, and the client is connecting to localhost (127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, localhost)
To change the IP the client is connecting to, look for GUI, EGUI, or jFrame (if it’s renamed) classes.

Look for the Serverip string.[/quote]

dude i need to write the class and path files under environmental variables, forward my port and connect my no ip to the server so i can log in [and other people], can u just do team view and show me how beacause i dint get much of what you just said here

Read full topic
item.source: Port forwrding and path files help on my first server

item.title: Port forwrding and path files help on my first server
item.dc:creator: @sone14 sone14
item.description:
@sone14 wrote:

Background~
Im using pk planets sorce for a 317 or which ever one it may be, i cant seem to wright the path and class path files, im following the “how to make a server” tut from the index.

Whats not working~
under Environmental variables, there was no CLASSPATH, file so i created one and under the value i copy and pasted what the classpath file is spouse to say, and the path file i deleted what it said and replaced it with what the PATH file was spouse to say, when i did ipconfig on CMD, i got a messege that it wasnt recagnized as a intarnal or external command, and i play another server and i thought id take a break and tryed to run it and it dint work eather, i serched env. varab. on wikipidea and copy and pasted what the path file was spouse to say, after i fixed the path files and deleted the classpath file i rebooted my computer and the client was working again.

What i need~
~Write the PATH & CLASSPATH files
~Portforward, i have a linkins wireless router so its a lot diffrent [looks a lot diffrent] than the tut so i dont know how to forward it correctlly
~No-ip, how to i connect it with my server, i made a host thing for it
~Getting it online [as in i cant log on and i want to launch ut]
~Also i want to know how to add new items from making the codes and making it from scratch like for a new cape, will you use a normal cape and just use it with paint to fix it up?

same for msn
